messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] litter & weeds
messages.msgSnippet: ... i meant it sounded like the park you were visiting is more littered than the one we visit.  we don t find much garbage there.  now, the street in front of
messages.messageBody:
>If they weren't littered, there was nothing to clean up.

i meant it sounded like the park you were visiting is more littered than
the one we visit. we don't find much garbage there. now, the street in
front of our house is atrocious. i don't know what people must be
thinking? (maybe they're just not thinking.)

>Goat heads are local stickers. Pulling a baby plant prevents >a hundred
or
>more serious stickers later.

lol...my husband has a picture of this giant goat trash can thing that
was at a park where he hung out with friends a bunch while he lived in
washington state before we met. it was a big brass sculpture that would
*eat* garbage like a real goat. i wondered if maybe this was a more
widespread phenomenon. :)

lisa

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
